name: Split Pea Soup with Pork Belly
author: vkarlson
summary: An easy and flavorful take on split pea soup. (Note: I often strain out the pieces of pork belly and run the soup through my food processor - I like my split pea soup really thick and creamy!)
ingredients: 1 cup vegetable broth, or more if needed
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Cook and stir onion and pork belly in a large pot over medium heat until pork is browned and onion is translucent, 10 to 15 minutes
Add water, vegetable broth, white wine, split peas, thyme, celery seed, bay leaves, salt, and pepper; stir to combine
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover, and simmer until flavors have combined, about 2 hours, stirring occasionally
